message.content:
cs.NE, cs.LG, cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.SD

The paper combines a hidden Markov model (HMM) with a spiking neural network (SNN) for classification of sequential data, which is a problem commonly addressed in the sub-categories of natural language processing (cs.CL), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), and machine learning (cs.LG). The use of a biologically based Bayesian computation and spike timing-dependent plasticity (STDP) learning rule suggests a focus on neural networks (cs.NE) and potentially also on systems and control (cs.SD) sub-categories.
